greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of partitions of n into distinct parts with smallest possible largest part.
comment: Size of the smallest possible largest part is floor(sqrt(2*n)+1/2) = A002024(n).  Records occur at 0, 7, and A000124(k) for k>=5.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: g:= proc(n, i) option remember; local s; s:=i*(i+1)/2;
mathematica: a /@ Range[0, 120] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 10 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Nov 18 2012
